title: Ticket #2852: CollectorList::query should pick a random collector vs. first in list.
description:
In the vain of scalability the CollectorList::query f(n) should pick a collector at random vs. the first in a list.

This should distribute the query load.
remarks:
2012-Mar-07 15:26:38 by jfrey:
My one concern with this patch is that daemons will no longer avoid collectors that are blacklisted (ones they know were unreachable recently).

2012-Mar-07 15:38:05 by tstclair:
I'm not following your comment, the blacklist code is still in place and should function exactly as it had before.

2012-Mar-07 16:17:43 by jfrey:
The calls daemon->blacklistMonitorQueryStarted() and daemon->blacklistMonitorQueryFinished() are for detecting a bad collector and blacklisting it. The first for-loop in CollectorList::query() is where the avoidance of bad collectors is done. They get shuffled to the end of sorted_collectors. In the original code, this meant they would be consulted last, only if all of the non-blacklisted collectors fail. With your change, blacklisted collectors are just as likely to be picked as non-blacklisted ones.

2012-Mar-09 14:18:33 by tstclair:
updated per comments.
